Breakdown: "- Thought: AI vs. Professors: A Stanford Freshman‚Äôs Take- A Stanford freshman, \"Austin Scholar,\" argues that AI and adaptive learning apps may be better at teaching than professors.- Reasons for this claim:- Professors cannot rewind and repeat explanations.- Professors can have bad days, make mistakes, or show favoritism.- Professors cannot adapt to different learning speeds simultaneously.- Question posed: What if professors were freed from daily lectures to focus on office hours and discussions?- Trend: The Math Crisis- The issue is not that students are failing to meet grade-level benchmarks.- The one-size-fits-all approach forces all students to move at the same pace, regardless of individual learning journeys.- Learning math is compared to building with blocks; missing foundational knowledge creates obstacles.- Tool: The 2-Hour Learning Revolution- Austin Scholar credits her success to Alpha Schools, established by MacKenzie Price.- Alpha Schools' model:- Students complete core academics by 10 AM using AI-powered tools.- Afternoons are dedicated to passion projects and real-world skills.- Adults serve as guides instead of traditional teachers.- Alpha Schools boast high average test scores and aim to generate excitement about learning.- Expansion plans in Miami, Austin, Brownsville, TX, and more locations in Arizona, California, and Florida.- (Word) of the Day: alpha- Definition:- Originates from the Greek letter Œë, signifying \"first letter.\"- Evolved meanings:- A leader or dominant force.- The first version of something new.- A measure of outperforming the standard.- Connection to Alpha Schools:- Leading innovation in education, pioneering a new model, and helping students excel in just two hours a day."

## ==From AI outperforming professors to 2-hour school days - rethinking how (and when) real learning happens==

==**In this edition:**==

- ==üéì Why a Stanford freshman says AI might outperform professors at teaching==
- ==üìâ The cascading effects of early math learning gaps==
- ==‚ö° Inside Alpha Schools' 2-hour learning revolution (and why it's working)==

### ==üí° THOUGHT==

## ==**AI vs. Professors: A Stanford Freshman‚Äôs Take**==

==A Stanford freshman who writes under the name ‚ÄúAustin Scholar‚Äù== [==just made a surprisingly persuasive case that AI and adaptive learning apps are better at teaching than her elite university instructors==](https://austinscholar.substack.com/p/austin-scholar-146-how-stanford-convinced?utm_source=opened-daily.beehiiv.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=a-stanford-student-s-take-on-ai-vs-professors-122)==. Why? She offers a few reasons:==

- ==A professor can't rewind and repeat==
- ==A professor can have a bad day, make mistakes, or play favorites==

==And perhaps most important:==

- ==_**A professor can't adapt to 30 different learning speeds simultaneously**_==

==What would happen if we freed the world‚Äôs most brilliant professors from daily lectures, and let them use that time for expanded office hours, Socratic discussions, and the like?==

==No, teachers aren‚Äôt going away. But their job might be changing.==

### ==üìä TREND==

## ==**The Math Crisis**==

[https://platform.twitter.com/embed/Tweet.html?dnt=false&embedId=twitter-widget-0&%3D%3D&frame=false&hideCard=false&hideThread=false&id=1879582318861422934&lang=en&origin=https%3A%2F%2Fopened-daily.beehiiv.com%2Fp%2Fa-stanford-student-s-take-on-ai-vs-professors-122&sessionId=140101519b9d83fc6f2d1c11635354c9db2817b7&theme=light&widgetsVersion=2615f7e52b7e0%3A1702314776716&width=550px](https://platform.twitter.com/embed/Tweet.html?dnt=false&embedId=twitter-widget-0&%3D%3D&frame=false&hideCard=false&hideThread=false&id=1879582318861422934&lang=en&origin=https%3A%2F%2Fopened-daily.beehiiv.com%2Fp%2Fa-stanford-student-s-take-on-ai-vs-professors-122&sessionId=140101519b9d83fc6f2d1c11635354c9db2817b7&theme=light&widgetsVersion=2615f7e52b7e0%3A1702314776716&width=550px)

==The real issue isn't that students are "failing" to hit arbitrary grade-level benchmarks. It's that our one-size-fits-all approach forces everyone to move at the same pace, regardless of their learning journey.==

==Math is like building with blocks ‚Äì miss one foundation piece, and everything above it gets shaky. Yet our system pushes students forward regardless, turning small gaps into insurmountable obstacles.==

### ==üõ†Ô∏è TOOL==

## ==The 2-Hour Learning Revolution==

==Speaking of Austin Scholar (and Stanford), she credits her academic success to== [==Alpha Schools==](https://alpha.school/?utm_source=opened-daily.beehiiv.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=a-stanford-student-s-take-on-ai-vs-professors-122)==, founded by Stanford mom MacKenzie Price after her own kids complained about boring school days. In the Alpha model, students finish core academics by 10 am using adaptive, AI-powered tools, then spend afternoons on passion projects and real-world skills. Adults serve as guides rather than traditional teachers.==

==Alpha touts their average test scores (top 1-2% nationally), but we‚Äôre more impressed by how they generate genuine excitement about learning. Alpha is expanding in Miami, Austin, and Brownsville, TX, with more planned locations in Arizona, California, and Florida.==

[![](https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/91edd264-ac79-452b-9b47-e2ad32dd4e06/Screenshot_2025-01-28_at_8.26.19_AM.png?t=1738081583)](https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/91edd264-ac79-452b-9b47-e2ad32dd4e06/Screenshot_2025-01-28_at_8.26.19_AM.png?t=1738081583)

### ==**(WORD) OF THE DAY**==

## ==**alpha**== ==(al¬∑fa)== ==_noun_==

==From the Greek letter Œë, this word has evolved from "first letter" to:==

- ==A leader or dominant force==
- ==The first version of something new==
- ==A measure of outperforming the standard==

==_Fitting that Alpha Schools are doing all three: leading education innovation, pioneering a new model, and helping students outperform national averages ‚Äì all in just 2 hours a day._==

==That‚Äôs all for today!==
